messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Letching for Alan Rickman & waiting for Harry Potter

messages.messageBody:
On 4 Nov 02, at 10:26, Liza Sabater wrote:

> Ahh! The Alan Rickman thread pops its delirious head again.
> What is it about that man?
> The voice, the voice, the voice!
> And that quasi-sleaze gaze of his.
> I loooooooooooved him Robin Hood.
>
> As Snape, let's see how he steals the show from Kenneth Branagh in
> Harry Potter.
>
> Remember y'all, it opens on the 15th. Yipee!
>
>

We're gonna need a seprate list fo Alan Rickman letching soon as
this topic constantly strays away from unschooling....

I guess not following a curriculum gives us plenty of time to think
about other things....like Mr Rickman ;-)

Shyrley whose kids are all in the basement doing thngs that do not
require me :-)


"You laugh at me because I'm different. I laugh at you because you are all the same."

messages.subject: Letching for Alan Rickman & waiting for Harry Potter
messages.msgSnippet: Ahh! The Alan Rickman thread pops its delirious head again. What is it about that man? The voice, the voice, the voice! And that quasi-sleaze gaze of his. I
messages.messageBody:
Ahh! The Alan Rickman thread pops its delirious head again.
What is it about that man?
The voice, the voice, the voice!
And that quasi-sleaze gaze of his.
I loooooooooooved him Robin Hood.

As Snape, let's see how he steals the show from Kenneth Branagh in
Harry Potter.

Remember y'all, it opens on the 15th. Yipee!




> >Heidi-hummina-hummina! wrote:
>
>>And through all of this, nobody's mentioned Sean Connery?
>>Sexiest man alive!
>>Voice makes me go all weak in the knees...
>>(although Paul Newman *may* have prettier eyes...)
>>Heidi-hummina-hummina!
>
>
>I love Sean in period costume: toga in Time Bandits and that glam Spanish
>bandit look in Highlander.
>
>Paul Newman's got great eyes but he's looking a bit calcified these days.
>
>Alan Rickman definitely has something... I wish I'd seen more of him as Snape,
>seems they must have cut quite a bit of him. He could play the bad guy if they
>ever make a movie out of Outlander. Too bad Sean's too old. He would have made
>a great Jamie. Sean and Alan, now THERE's a movie. ;)
>
>Peggy
>

Awwwwwwwwwww man.
Just as I move here, he leaves.
Now I'm stuck onna continent with nothing. I'm going back to
England!
Oh, hang on...Val Kilmer is still here is he not?
And Richard Dean Anderson.....maybe I'll stay awhile....

Shyrley

PS> How long does homesickness take to go away?


"You laugh at me because I'm different. I laugh at you because you are all the same."

messages.subject: Letching for Alan Rickman (was Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 584)
messages.msgSnippet: ... I love Sean in period costume: toga in Time Bandits and that glam Spanish bandit look in Highlander. Paul Newman s got great eyes but he s looking a bit
messages.messageBody:
>Heidi-hummina-hummina! wrote:

>And through all of this, nobody's mentioned Sean Connery?
>Sexiest man alive!
>Voice makes me go all weak in the knees...
>(although Paul Newman *may* have prettier eyes...)
>Heidi-hummina-hummina!


I love Sean in period costume: toga in Time Bandits and that glam Spanish
bandit look in Highlander.

Paul Newman's got great eyes but he's looking a bit calcified these days.

Alan Rickman definitely has something... I wish I'd seen more of him as Snape,
seems they must have cut quite a bit of him. He could play the bad guy if they
ever make a movie out of Outlander. Too bad Sean's too old. He would have made
a great Jamie. Sean and Alan, now THERE's a movie. ;)

Peggy
